id.description: The ID used to identify this component.

data.description:
The hierarchical data to display.
Each item should have arbitrary properties and an optional children array.

columns.description:
Array of column definitions that specify which fields to display.
Each column should have a name property, and can optionally have width, label, and align.
Example: [{ name: 'title', label: 'Title', width: '200px', align: 'left' }]

colors.description: Color configuration for hover and selected states.

uniqueKey.description:
Property name in data items to use as unique identifier.
Default is 'id'.

dataKey.description:
Property name to use when comparing selected row with current row.
Default is the same as uniqueKey.

highlightKey.description: Optional secondary property to check when determining if a row should be highlighted.

style.description: Inline styles to apply to the container.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to the container.

setProps.description: Callback that should be called to report property changes.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

data.description:
The hierarchical data to display.
Each item should have a name, percentage, and optional children array.

styles.description: Inline styles to apply to the outer div.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to the outer div.

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.

selectedItem.description:
Object representing the currently selected item (controlled component pattern).
This will be updated when a row is clicked.
Contains all properties of the selected item except the 'children' array.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

data.description:
The hierarchical data to display.
Each item should have arbitrary columns and an optional children array.

columns.description:
Array of column definitions.
Each column should have a name and optional width property.
Example: [{ name: 'Forecast Decomposition', width: '250px' }, { name: 'January 2024' }]

indexColumnName.description:
Name of the column to use as the index (leftmost column).
This column will be sticky when horizontally scrolling.

style.description: Inline styles to apply to the outer div.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to the outer div.

selectedItem.description:
Object representing the currently selected item (controlled component pattern).
This will be updated when a row is clicked.
Contains all properties of the selected item except the 'children' array.

selectedColumn.description:
Object representing the currently selected column (controlled component pattern).
This will be updated when a column header is clicked.
Contains the column name and data which is an array of objects with the index column value and the value for this column.

selectedColumnHierarchy.description:
Object representing the currently selected column in hierarchical format.
This preserves the original hierarchy of the data structure.
Each node contains the index column value, the selected column value, and any children.

indexColumnWidth.description:
Width of the index column (leftmost column).
Can be updated by the user via drag-to-resize.

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.
